headline: Brissopsis lyrifera  Spiny heart in the mud
text: Description A reddish-brown heart urchin around 7cm long. Ecology Like other urchins, this species relies on its "test" for defence. The test is series of skeletal plates (or petals) joined to form a complete shell. This urchin's test is formed from five petals and covered in coarse, mobile spines. Heart urchins are burrowing animals  this is the only species of heart urchin likely to be found in muddy sediments. Distribution Recorded off the west, north and east coasts of the British Isles, but not off the south coast. Common in deep water.
